Posted By: Superllama12 (4/30/2011 5:15:48 PM)

posts.post_content:
Hah, this guy is unabashedly bad! We don't even get any flavour text to help explain **why** the hoodlums can't block!
  
   
Along the same lines of what I did for [Wurmskin Forger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmskin Forger), here are your possible alternatives **at common** for ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol):
  
   
[Ashenmoor Cohort](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ashenmoor Cohort)   
[Bog Serpent](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Bog Serpent)   
[Corpulent Corpse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Corpulent Corpse)   
[Crawling Filth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Crawling Filth)   
[Deathcurse Ogre](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathcurse Ogre)   
[Gempalm Polluter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gempalm Polluter)   
[Twisted Abomination](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twisted Abomination)   
[Undead Leotau](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Undead Leotau)   
   
...oh wow, yuck. ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol) common creatures are actually generally pretty bad. Twisted Abomination and the Gempalm are pretty good, but they go downhill fast! Let this be a lesson to you - if you see a mana cost of ![5](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=5&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol), begin backing away slowly...

Posted By: Shoe2 (6/8/2011 11:27:59 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I remember this card. I started playing summer of 2008 (the summer after the *Lorwyn/Shadowmoor* block) and so my mindset was tribal. I opened a Tenth Edition starter pack and got a [Raging Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Raging Goblin) and a [Siege-Gang Commander](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Siege-Gang Commander) which prompted me to go Goblin tribal. However, I also liked Zombies so I decided to make my deck Zombie/Goblin ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) tribal (the idea of having multiple decks was crazy for me at the time). I kind of went on a break from Magic until the next summer, where I bought the Alara reborn ![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol)![Red](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=R&type=symbol) "Dead Ahead " Deck. It came with a [Deathbringer Thoctar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Deathbringer Thoctar) and a [Lightning Reaver](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lightning Reaver) and I was like "Red and black Zombies? Awesome!" For the Goblin portion, I really wanted [Festering Goblin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Festering Goblin), but something caught my eye: This card. I believe i traded a [Remove Soul](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Remove Soul) for it. Yes, I actually traded for this card.
posts.html:
I remember this card. I started playing summer of 2008 (the summer after the Lorwyn/Shadowmoor block) and so my mindset was tribal. I opened a Tenth Edition starter pack and got a Raging Goblin and a Siege-Gang Commander which prompted me to go Goblin tribal. However, I also liked Zombies so I decided to make my deck Zombie/Goblin tribal (the idea of having multiple decks was crazy for me at the time). I kind of went on a break from Magic until the next summer, where I bought the Alara reborn "Dead Ahead " Deck. It came with a Deathbringer Thoctar and a Lightning Reaver and I was like "Red and black Zombies? Awesome!" For the Goblin portion, I really wanted Festering Goblin, but something caught my eye: This card. I believe i traded a Remove Soul for it. Yes, I actually traded for this card.

Posted By: Dolorosa (1/12/2012 9:07:08 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Wood Elemental is forgivable since WotC had no clue what they were doing back then. Crud like this makes it very clear they know \*exactly\* what they are doing - printing common garbage to waste space in boosters so folks rush out and buy more in the hopes of getting a playable card. Compare with Grave Titan, remember that rarity is not supposed to equal power and mythics were not supposed to be tournament staples, and you'll see what I mean.
posts.html:
Wood Elemental is forgivable since WotC had no clue what they were doing back then. Crud like this makes it very clear they know *exactly* what they are doing - printing common garbage to waste space in boosters so folks rush out and buy more in the hopes of getting a playable card. Compare with Grave Titan, remember that rarity is not supposed to equal power and mythics were not supposed to be tournament staples, and you'll see what I mean.
